page.title: 08Honiton Pottery
page.content: The pottery was established in 1881 upon the same site at the end of the High Street. Paul Redvers, the owner employs 45 people. Traditionallly the pots were hand painted but now there is a photographic method of decoration. Pottery is exported to 6 countries. An attractive shop in front of the factory sells a variety of goods to the many visitors to the town; lamps, crockery and baking dishes are most popular. Visitors can see the moulding, firing and decoration processes in the factory. There is also a coffee shop which uses the crockery made at Honiton Pottery.
